original: bstan su med pa /
analyzed: bstan su med pa /
translated: without a basis,

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: and with a single defining characteristic, which is no defining characteristic at all.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad bskyed pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha @192a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad bskyed pa ste / rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha @192a *//
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom generates all the eloquence and all the illumination of all dharmas.

original: rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdud dam /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdud dam /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom cannot be split or carried off by Māra or

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
translated: the gods of Māra’s class,

original: gang zag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa nas /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa nas /
translated: or by individuals in the Śrāvaka Vehicle or the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: mu stegs can gzhan gyi bar dang; sdig pa'i grogs po rnams kyis mi phyed mi 'phrogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan gyi bar dang; sdig pa'i grogs po rnams kyis mi phyed mi 'phrogs pa ste /
translated: or by other tīrthikas or evil companions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to practice this perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is because it is empty of its own defining characteristics.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because in this perfection of wisdom all these are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great beings practice the meaning of this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyod pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the meaning of this deep perfection of wisdom

original: mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the meaning of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the meaning of suffering,

original: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o; ;sdug bsngal shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o; ;sdug bsngal shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the meaning of no-self, should practice the meaning of the knowledge of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don dang / 'gog pa shes pa'i don dang / lam shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don dang / 'gog pa shes pa'i don dang / lam shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the meaning of the knowledge of the origin, the meaning of the knowledge of cessation, and the meaning of the knowledge of the path,

original: zad pa shes pa'i don dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i don dang / chos shes pa'i don dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i don dang / kun rdzob shes pa'i don dang / yongs su rtog pa shes pa'i don @192b dang; sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa'i don dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i don dang / chos shes pa'i don dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i don dang / kun rdzob shes pa'i don dang / yongs su rtog pa shes pa'i don @192b dang; sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of the knowledge of extinction, the meaning of the knowledge of non-production, the meaning of the knowledge of the teaching, the meaning of the knowledge of following, the meaning of conventional knowledge, the meaning of the knowledge of thorough conceptualization, and the meaning of the knowledge of the way things are.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the meaning of the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la /
translated: if in this deep perfection of wisdom

original: don dang don ma lags pa mi dmigs na /
analyzed: don dang don ma lags pa mi dmigs na /
translated: neither meaning nor non-meaning is apprehended,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyad par bgyi /
translated: how then should bodhisattva great beings practice the meaning of this deep perfection of wisdom?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom

original: 'di ltar spyad par bya ste /🔽'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyad par bya ste / 'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: should practice like this:

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽zhe sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // zhe sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Attachment is for my benefit’ or ‘it is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Aversion is for my benefit’ or ‘it is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Delusion is for my benefit’ or ‘it is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyod par mi bya'o //🔽log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyod par mi bya'o // log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Attachment, aversion, and delusion are for my benefit’ or ‘they are not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽lta bar gyur pa thams cad bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // lta bar gyur pa thams cad bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Wrong views are for my benefit’ or ‘they are not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: ‘All views are for my benefit’ or ‘they are not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don du mi byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don du mi byed /
translated: The thatness of desire,🔽hatred, and confusion does not make anything meaningful.🔽

original: don ma yin par mi byed do //🔽lta ba'i rnam pa dag @193a *//
analyzed: don ma yin par mi byed do // lta ba'i rnam pa dag @193a *//
translated: The suchness of desire, anger, and ignorance does not make anything meaningful or meaningless.

original: gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don du mi byed /🔽don ma yin par mi byed do //
analyzed: gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don du mi byed / don ma yin par mi byed do //
translated: The suchness of the views does not make anything meaningful or meaningless.

original: gzugs bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “You should not practice thinking, ‘Form is meaningful for me.’

original: gzugs bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘Form is meaningless for me.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are meaningful for me.’

original: rnam par shes pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘Consciousness is meaningless for me.’

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘The sense domains, elements, and dependent origination are meaningful for me.’

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘Dependent origination is meaningless for me.’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not practice the thought, “The perfections, the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are for my benefit.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He should not practice the thought, “The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not for my benefit.”🔽He should not practice the thought, “The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are for my benefit.”

original: gzungs kyi sgo bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not practice the thought, “The dhāraṇī gateways are not for my benefit.”

original: @193b de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: @193b de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should not be practiced as ‘my aim.’

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should not be practiced as ‘not my aim.’

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should not be practiced as ‘my aim.’

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should not be practiced as ‘not my aim.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos gang don du bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang don du bya ba'am /
translated: I do not apprehend any dharma that is a matter of concern,

original: don med par bya ba de lta bu gang yang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: don med par bya ba de lta bu gang yang ma dmigs so //
translated: or that is not a matter of concern.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyes kyang rung /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyes kyang rung /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, whether the tathāgatas have arisen

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma skyes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma skyes kyang rung ste /
translated: or whether the tathāgatas have not arisen,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid ni gnas pa /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid ni gnas pa /
translated: the true nature of dharmas, the abiding nature of dharmas,

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa ste /🔽de ni gang la'ang don kyang mi byed /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa ste / de ni gang la'ang don kyang mi byed /
translated: and the dharma-constituent remain.🔽That does not do anything for anyone,

original: don ma yin pa'ang mi byed do //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos don dang don ma yin pa spangs te /
analyzed: don ma yin pa'ang mi byed do // rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos don dang don ma yin pa spangs te /
translated: nor does it not do anything for anyone.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that, having rejected what is a matter of concern and what is not a matter of concern.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la'ang don kyang @194a *//
analyzed: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la'ang don kyang @194a *//
translated: why does the perfection of wisdom not do anything for anyone,

original: mi bgyid / don ma lags pa'ang mi bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: mi bgyid / don ma lags pa'ang mi bgyid pa lags /
translated: nor not do anything for anyone?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid gang yang mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid gang yang mi byed de /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom does not cause any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena to be produced.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang don du byed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang don du byed pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom does not cause anything to be produced as a benefit.

original: don ma yin par byed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ma yin par byed pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It does not cause anything to be produced as a harm.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na 'dus ma bgyis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na 'dus ma bgyis /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam /
translated: then is the unconditioned not a benefit for the buddhas and all the noble hearers of the buddhas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'dus ma byas ni sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don kyang yin te /
translated: “The unconditioned is a benefit for the buddhas and all the noble hearers of the buddhas.

original: phan pa'am / gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan pa'am / gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist as something that is beneficial or harmful.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang phan pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang phan pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: the suchness of space does not exist as something that is beneficial or harmful.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang chos gang la'ang phan pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang chos gang la'ang phan pa'am /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva great being does not stand in any dharma as helpful or

original: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: harmful.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dus ma bgyis kyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dus ma bgyis kyi /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Well then, Lord,🔽do bodhisattva great beings not train in the perfection of wisdom of the uncompounded

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: and

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi bgyid dam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi bgyid dam /
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom @194b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @194b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs shing; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs shing; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
translated: It is just as you have said.🔽Bodhisattva great beings training in this deep perfection of wisdom

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects, but not by way of the two.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: “Lord, is it that

original: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos thob par bgyid dam /
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos thob par bgyid dam /
translated: “Is a nondual phenomenon attained by a nondual phenomenon?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / 'o na gnyis kyi chos shig gnyis kyi chos thob bar bgyid pa lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / 'o na gnyis kyi chos shig gnyis kyi chos thob bar bgyid pa lags sam /
translated: “Well then, is a dual phenomenon attained by a dual phenomenon?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / 'o na ji ltar thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / 'o na ji ltar thob par 'gyur /
translated: “Well then, how is it attained?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽nam gnyis kyi chos sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / nam gnyis kyi chos sam /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs pa ni thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs pa ni thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “When neither a dual phenomenon nor a nondual phenomenon is observed, it is attained.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs pa ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni thob pa ste /
translated: Nonobservation is attainment.

original: de ni dmigs pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: It is not attained through observation,

original: mi dmigs pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: nor is it attained through nonobservation.”

original: le'u lnga bcu gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu gsum pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifty-third chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @195a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @195a *//
translated: Lord,🔽it is hard for a bodhisattva great being to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chub tu zhugs pa'ang dka' ba bgyid pa lags te /🔽sems can zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: chub tu zhugs pa'ang dka' ba bgyid pa lags te / sems can zhes bgyi'am /
translated: For what reason?

original: sems can du gdags pa ni gang yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa ni gang yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Because, Lord, a being, or the designation of a being, is not apprehended.

original: de dag ni sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so //
translated: They set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig nam mkha' gzhi ma mchis pa la ljang bu bskyed par 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig nam mkha' gzhi ma mchis pa la ljang bu bskyed par 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as someone might want to plant a tree in space, which has no ground to stand on,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sems can rnams kyi slad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sems can rnams kyi slad du /
translated: in the same way, Lord, bodhisattva great beings set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'tshal lo //
translated: I want to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi phyir /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: and having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'grel pa ni /

original: dka' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba byed pa'o //

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig ljang bu bskyed par 'dod la /

original: skyes bu des ljang bu de'i rtsa ba ma dmigs /
analyzed: skyes bu des ljang bu de'i rtsa ba ma dmigs /

analyzed: dus dus su chus bran @195b cing; de'i sdong bu de rim gyis yal ga phun sum tshogs par gyur /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de la lo ma ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten cing /

analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'o //
translated: and the gods of the realm of the infinity of space, the realm of the infinity of consciousness, the realm of nothingness, and the realm of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'bras bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
translated: “The result is that bodhisattva great beings, having attained omniscience,

analyzed: sems can de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la rab tu 'god pa dang /
translated: in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽and in the state of a bodhisattva, and on the basis of that very bodhisattva they will attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de nyid la brten cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de nyid la brten cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /

translated: they will live by the fruit that is the support of all beings, and those who have offered them gifts will gradually

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /

analyzed: theg pa chen @196b po'am /

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur yang /

translated: although they will attain nirvana through those three vehicles and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

original: de la sems can du'ang mi 'dogs /
analyzed: de la sems can du'ang mi 'dogs /
translated: they will not impute sentient beings,

original: sems can du gdags pa'ang med par sems can de dag kyang sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'ang med par sems can de dag kyang sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'grel pa ste /
translated: and without imputing sentient beings, they will liberate those sentient beings from the apprehension of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /🔽gang gi don du bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sems can nam /

translated: “Subhūti, in that way, although bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can du gdags pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: they do not apprehend any sentient beings or any imputation of sentient beings for the sake of whom they should attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should be known as tathāgatas.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten na /
translated: it is because, on the basis of the bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the hells are brought to an end,

original: byol song gi skye gnas thams cad dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //🔽mi khom pa dang / ngan song thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //🔽dbul po thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas thams cad dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro // mi khom pa dang / ngan song thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro // dbul po thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the animal realms and all the worlds of the Lord of Death are brought to an end,🔽all the unfavorable conditions and all the lower realms are brought to an end,🔽all poverty is brought to an end,

original: lam gyi rgyud dma' ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi rgyud dma' ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the lower realms are brought to an end,

original: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the desire realms are brought to an end,

original: gzugs kyi khams thams cad @197a *//
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams thams cad @197a *//
translated: all the form realms

original: rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: are brought to an end,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all the formless realms are brought to an end.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is the Tathāgata himself.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po med na /
translated: Subhūti, if there were no bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod par mi 'gyur /
translated: the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the past, future, and present buddhas would not exist.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas would not appear in the world.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Arhats, non-returners, once-returners, and stream-enterers would not appear in the world.

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: All the hells would not be cut off.

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang; gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang; gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: All the animal realms and the world of Yama would not be cut off.

original: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: the entire desire realm will not be cut off,

original: gzugs kyi khams thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the entire form realm will not be cut off, and the entire formless realm will not be cut off.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na gang 'di skad du /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, those who say,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin @197b gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes zer ba ni /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin @197b gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes zer ba ni / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: ‘Bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known to be tathāgatas,’🔽Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is just so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known to be tathāgatas. And why?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis 'phags pa thams cad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis gzugs su gdags pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis 'phags pa thams cad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis gzugs su gdags pa dang /
translated: Subhuti, the Suchness by which the Tathagata is conceived, the Suchness by which the Pratyekabuddha is conceived, the Suchness by which all the holy men are conceived, the Suchness by which form is conceived,

original: de bzhin nyid gang gis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang gis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
translated: the Suchness by which feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness are conceived, the Suchness by which the sense-fields, elements, and the dependent origination are conceived, the Suchness by which all the perfections are conceived,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,🔽the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations,🔽and the dhāraṇī gateways are designated,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @198a *//
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @198a *//
translated: and the suchness by means of which the ten tathāgata powers,

original: bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gdags pa dang /
analyzed: bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gdags pa dang /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de bzhin nyid gang gis 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du gdags pa de dag thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang gis 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du gdags pa de dag thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin te /
translated: and the compounded element and the uncompounded element, all of them are just that.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘suchness.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid de la bslabs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid de la bslabs shing /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having trained in that suchness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects, and therefore are called ‘tathāgatas.’

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, because of this one of many explanations

original: de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas te /
translated: you should take suchness as the measure

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings are tathāgatas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom that is suchness.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who train in the perfection of wisdom that is suchness

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la slob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la slob bo //
translated: train in the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la bslabs shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la bslabs shing /
translated: Having trained in the suchness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: they perfect the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: Having perfected the suchness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams @198b cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dbang du gyur pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams @198b cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dbang du gyur pa thob par byed do //
translated: they attain mastery of the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dbang du gyur pa thob par byas shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dbang du gyur pa thob par byas shing /
translated: They attain mastery over the suchness of all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas par byed do //
translated: They become skilled in the faculties of all sentient beings.

original: dbang po la mkhas par byas shing /🔽dbang po yongs su bskang ba la mkhas pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po la mkhas par byas shing / dbang po yongs su bskang ba la mkhas pa thob par byed do //
translated: Having become skilled in the faculties,🔽they attain skill in fulfilling the faculties.

original: dbang po yongs su bskang ba la mkhas pa thob par byas shing /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su bskang ba la mkhas pa thob par byas shing /
translated: Having attained skill in fulfilling the faculties,

original: sems can rnams kyi las rang gi byas pa shes par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las rang gi byas pa shes par byed do //
translated: they make known to sentient beings the knowledge of their own actions.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang gi las shes par byas shing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang gi las shes par byas shing /
translated: Having made known to sentient beings the knowledge of their own actions,

original: smon pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: smon pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: they perfect the wisdom of aspiration.

original: smon pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: smon pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: Having perfected the wisdom of aspiration,

original: dus gsum du ye shes rnam par dag par byed do //
analyzed: dus gsum du ye shes rnam par dag par byed do //
translated: they purify wisdom in the three times.

original: dus gsum du ye shes rnam par dag par byas shing /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: dus gsum du ye shes rnam par dag par byas shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having purified wisdom in the three times,🔽they benefit sentient beings by engaging in the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
translated: They benefit sentient beings

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: they purify a buddhafield;

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas shing /
translated: having purified a buddhafield,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: they attain the knowledge of all aspects;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas shing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas shing /
translated: having attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: they turn the wheel of the Dharma;

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cing /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cing /
translated: having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god do //
translated: they establish sentient beings in the three vehicles;

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu bkod nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu bkod nas /
translated: having established sentient beings in the three vehicles,

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o /
translated: they pass into the realm of nirvāṇa that has no remainder of the skandhas;

original: @199a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @199a *// rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yon tan dang / legs pa thams cad mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yon tan dang / legs pa thams cad mthong nas /
translated: seeing all those good qualities and virtues,

original: bdag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: they should also arouse the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: They should also cause others to give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'o //
translated: are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa /
translated: “Blessed One, if a bodhisattva great being who has given rise to the first level of bodhichitta

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de'i bsod nams ji tsam zhig tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de'i bsod nams ji tsam zhig tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: and who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood for the benefit of all sentient beings were to increase his merit, how much merit would he increase?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / gal te @199b stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te @199b stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad /
translated: “Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a great trichiliocosm

original: nyan thos kyi sa la gnas par gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la gnas par gyur /
translated: were to abide in the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par gyur na /
translated: and in the pratyekabuddha level,

original: sems can de dag gi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lam /
translated: would their merit increase greatly?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽it would increase greatly, Sugata.

original: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tshad ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshad ma mchis so //
translated: it would be immeasurable.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: tshad ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshad ma mchis so //
translated: it would be immeasurable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, the merit of all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm who have become followers of the vehicle of the hearers🔽or the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and the merit of a bodhisattva great being who possesses the generation of the first thought of awakening—

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa'i bsod nams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de la ni /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa'i bsod nams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de la ni / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: compared to the accumulation of merit of a bodhisattva who possesses the generation of the first thought of awakening,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa de dag gi bsod nams des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa de dag gi bsod nams des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: the merit of all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm who have become followers of the vehicle of the hearers or the vehicle of the solitary buddhas does not even approach a hundredth part.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang; bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //🔽grangs dang / cha dang @200a *//🔽bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang; bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o // grangs dang / cha dang @200a *// bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: Let alone being a follower of the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad nyan thos kyi yon tan dang ldan par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad nyan thos kyi yon tan dang ldan par gyur kyang /
translated: if all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm were to become endowed with the qualities of the śrāvakas,

original: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: the merit from that would not even come close to a hundredth of the merit of the bodhisattva who has given rise to the first level of bodhicitta.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not even come close to a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, or a trillionth of that merit.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: It would not even stand up to a simile, or to a comparison.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni /🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams te /
translated: Why is that?🔽The qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas come from the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ni /
translated: The qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not come from the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos kyi yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa'am /
translated: Leave aside all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm endowed with the qualities of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang @200b ldan par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang @200b ldan par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: or endowed with the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /🔽de dag gis bsod nams des /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang / de dag gis bsod nams des /
translated: If all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm were to stand on the stage of seeing white dharmas,🔽their merit would not come close to a hundredth of the merit

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: of the bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of awakening.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not come close to a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a ten millionth, a billionth, or even a quintillionth of that merit.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: It would not stand up to any comparison.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas pa rnams te /
translated: Those who have arisen from the bodhisattvas are those who abide in the stage of seeing what is wholesome.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las byung ba ni /
translated: Those who have arisen from the stage of seeing what is wholesome

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
translated: are not the bodhisattva great beings.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: Let alone all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm abiding in the stage of seeing what is wholesome,

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
translated: if all those sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm were to abide in the stage of lineage,

original: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: their merit would not approach even a hundredth part of the merit of the bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of awakening.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not even bear comparison to a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part, or a billionth part, or even a quintillionth part.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: It would not even bear comparison to a fraction of a part.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems @201a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems @201a *//
translated: The bodhisattvas

original: dpa' las byung ba ni rigs kyi sa la gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: dpa' las byung ba ni rigs kyi sa la gnas pa rnams te /
translated: are the ones who come from the stage of the lineage.

original: rigs kyi sa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa las byung ba ni /
translated: The ones who come from the stage of the lineage

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
translated: are not the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: “Set aside the merit of all the sentient beings in the worlds in the great billion-world universe who are on the stage of the lineage.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad brgyad pa'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad brgyad pa'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
translated: If all the sentient beings in the worlds in the great billion-world universe were to be on the eighth stage,

original: de dag gi bsod nams des /
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams des /
translated: their merit

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //🔽stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o // stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a hundredth part of the merit of the bodhisattva who has produced the first thought of enlightenment.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth or a hundred thousandth part, or any fraction, of a calculation, of a simile, or of a comparison.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni brgyad pa'i sa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni brgyad pa'i sa rnams te /
translated: The stages of the eighth level arise from the bodhisattva.

analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings do not arise from the stages of the eighth level.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad brgyad pa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad brgyad pa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /

original: de dag gi bsod nams des /
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams des /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char @201b yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char @201b yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //

analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //

analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
