analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams te /
translated: Those who have arisen from the bodhisattvas are those who stand on the stage of understanding what has been done.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa las byung ba ni /
translated: Those who have arisen from the stage of understanding what has been done are

original: byang @202b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: byang @202b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no //
translated: not the bodhisattva great beings.🔽Suppose all the sentient beings of the great billionfold world system were to stand on the stage of understanding what has been done.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad byas pa rtogs pa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad rang sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad byas pa rtogs pa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad rang sangs rgyas kyi
translated: Even the merit of all those sentient beings of the great billionfold world system who stand on the stage of the pratyekabuddha

original: sa la gnas par gyur kyang de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: sa la gnas par gyur kyang de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: does not approach even a hundredth part of the merit of the bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of awakening.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth or a hundred thousandth part, or even a one hundred thousandth of a billionth part.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: It is not even comparable to the cause.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas arise from bodhisattvas,🔽but bodhisattva great beings do not arise from pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no; ;stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin no; ;stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: Let alone all the sentient beings of the great billionfold world system abiding on the level of pratyekabuddhas,

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur kyang /
translated: if all the sentient beings of the great billionfold world system were to enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas,

original: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' rang byang chub tu zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams des byang chub sems dpa' rang byang chub tu zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: their merit would not even come close to a hundredth of the merit of a bodhisattva who has entered into pratyekabuddhahood.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part, or a one billionth part, or a one ten billionth part of it.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //🔽stong gsum @203a *//
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i bar du'ang mi bzod do // stong gsum @203a *//
translated: It cannot bear comparison, cannot bear counting, cannot bear reckoning, cannot bear measuring, cannot bear being added up, cannot bear being totalled up, cannot bear being made equal to, even up to an analogy.🔽Suppose all the sentient beings in a great billionfold

original: gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur pa lta zhog gi /
translated: world system were to enter the faultless state of a bodhisattva.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub tu zhugs par gyur kyang de dag gi bsod nams des /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad byang chub tu zhugs par gyur kyang de dag gi bsod nams des /
translated: Even if all the sentient beings in a great billionfold world system were to enter the awakened state, the merit from that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: would not approach even a hundredth part of the merit from the Tathāgata, the Saint, the genuinely and fully awake Buddha’s merit.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not be a fraction, a hundredth, a thousandth, a one hundred thousandth of a fraction of that, up to it would not stand up to any comparison.

original: grangs su'ang mi bzod /🔽char yang mi bzod /🔽bgrang bar yang mi bzod /🔽dper yang mi bzod /
analyzed: grangs su'ang mi bzod / char yang mi bzod / bgrang bar yang mi bzod / dper yang mi bzod /
translated: It would not be able to stand up to being counted,🔽it would not be able to stand up to being measured,🔽it would not be able to stand up to being enumerated,🔽it would not be able to stand up to being compared,🔽it would not be able to stand up to being likened,

original: rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: it would not be able to stand up to being equated.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pas ci yid la bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pas ci yid la bgyi /
translated: what should a bodhisattva great being who has given rise to the first level of the mind do?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya'o //
translated: “They should pay attention to the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dngos po ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dngos po ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: what is the knowledge of all aspects like?

original: dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig mchis /🔽dbang sgyur ba ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig mchis / dbang sgyur ba ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: What is its object?🔽What is its mastery?

original: rnam pa ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: What are its aspects?

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: What are its characteristics?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, the so-called knowledge of all aspects

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: is non-entity,

original: mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: is without defining characteristics,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: is without signs,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: is without activity,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: is unborn,🔽and is unarisen.

original: 'byung ba med pa @203b ste; rab 'byor /🔽gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa @203b ste; rab 'byor / gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Subhūti, when you say,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig yod ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig yod ces zer ba ni /
translated: ‘What is the object of the knowledge of all aspects?’

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is without an object.🔽It is controlled by mindfulness,

original: dran pas dbang sgyur ba dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa /
analyzed: dran pas dbang sgyur ba dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa /
translated: is of the aspect of peace,

original: mtshan nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yin te /
translated: and is without defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, this is the object of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni dbang sgyur ba'o //🔽'di ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang sgyur ba'o // 'di ni rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the control.🔽This is the aspect.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the defining characteristic.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ba' zhig dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci lags / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ba' zhig dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽is only the knowledge of all aspects non-entity,

original: ma lags kyi /
analyzed: ma lags kyi /
translated: or are all dharmas also non-entity?”

original: gzugs kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: gzugs kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags /
translated: and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not real things;🔽the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are not real things;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags; pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dngos po ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags; pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dngos po ma mchis pa lags /
translated: all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not real things;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: the sense fields, the components of perception, and dependent origination are also unreal.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven factors of awakening are also unreal.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are also unreal.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / @204b dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'ang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / @204b dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'ang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: great joy, and great equanimity are also non-entities.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The compounded element and the uncompounded element are also non-entities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects has no intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that which has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags /
translated: why is the knowledge of all aspects without intrinsic nature?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: “Subhūti, the nature of a composite is absent.

original: gang la 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: That which is absent the nature of a composite is a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: all phenomena are the intrinsic nature of non-entities.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are the essence of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are the essence of signlessness.

original: chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are the essence of wishlessness.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are the essence of suchness.

original: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are the essence of the limit of reality.

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are the essence of the dharma-constituent.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because of this one of many explanations you should know that all dharmas are the essence of non-entityness.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: de ltar gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are the essence of non-entityness,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa thabs gang dang ldan pas /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa thabs gang dang ldan pas /
translated: then what skillful means does a bodhisattva great being have when they first give rise to the thought,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: How do they practice the perfection of generosity

original: @205a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: @205a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: How do they practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?🔽How do they practice the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la spyod cing; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la spyod cing; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la spyod cing /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la spyod cing /
translated: How do they practice love, compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la spyod cing /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la spyod cing /
translated: How do they practice the station of endless space, the station of endless consciousness, the station of nothingness, and the station of neither perception nor nonperception,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du spyod cing /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du spyod cing /
translated: How do they practice inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / @205b sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / @205b sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?”

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations for supernormal ability, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: They purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They practice the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /🔽byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag dang / sems can de dag kyang dngos po med pa'i @206a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag dang / sems can de dag kyang dngos po med pa'i @206a *//
translated: those buddhafields and those sentient beings are also non-entities.🔽

original: ngo bo nyid du shes pa de nyid /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du shes pa de nyid / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas pa ste /
translated: those buddha-fields and those sentient beings are known to be the nature of non-entityness.🔽That itself is the skill in means of bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: are familiar with the path to awakening.

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: They are familiar with the path to awakening while practicing the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
translated: They practice inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: They familiarize themselves with the path to enlightenment.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: They familiarize themselves with the path to enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They practice the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete liberations, the states of composure, emptiness, signlessness, and

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa @206b dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa @206b dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod cing /
translated: and the emptiness of essential nature, and they practice the applications of mindfulness, and similarly, they practice the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path, and they practice the ten powers of the tathāgatas, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: and they practice the path to awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the knowledge of path aspects, and they practice the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: and they practice the path to awakening.

original: byang chub kyi lam de'ang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam de'ang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu shes te /
translated: And they know that path to awakening to be essentially nonexistent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: nam de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par ma gyur pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: nam de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par ma gyur pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po dang /
translated: until they have the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, great compassion,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par ma gyur pa de'i bar du /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par ma gyur pa de'i bar du /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub kyi lam de la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam de la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: In the meantime, they familiarize themselves with that path to enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam ste /
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ path.

original: lam de la gnas shing /
analyzed: lam de la gnas shing /
translated: Standing on that path,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: they complete all the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed all the perfections,

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: they attain the knowledge of all aspects in a single moment of wisdom.

original: de'i tshe de'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi skye bar spang bas yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi skye bar spang bas yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, all the afflictions that are connected to the latent tendencies will also be completely abandoned, because they will have been abandoned by not being produced.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la rnam par lta na /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la rnam par lta na /
translated: When he looks with the eye of the Buddha at the world systems in the great trichiliocosm,

original: dngos po med par yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dngos po med par yang mi dmigs na /
translated: he does not apprehend even non-entities,

original: dngos po yod par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dngos po yod par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone entities.

original: rab @207a *// 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab @207a *// 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
translated: they give gifts.

original: de ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtong yang /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtong yang /
translated: Even though they give gifts in this way,

original: mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: they do not conceptualize and do not form mental images.🔽They do not pay attention to entities

original: dngos po yod pa'am /🔽dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am / dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: or non-entities.

original: len pa la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: len pa la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: They do not conceptualize and do not form mental images of the recipients,

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: and they do not pay attention to entities🔽or non-entities.

original: gtong ba la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: gtong ba la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: When giving, they do not conceptualize or form mental images of it.

original: dngos po med par yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not pay attention to whether it is a real thing or not.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: They do not apprehend the thought of awakening.

original: mtshan mar mi byed yul du mi byed par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed yul du mi byed par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see it as a mental image or as an object.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: tshul khrims srung /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung /
translated: they guard ethical discipline,

original: bzod pa sgom /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom /
translated: cultivate patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom /
translated: exert diligence,

original: bsam gtan la goms par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan la goms par byed /
translated: become familiar with concentration,

original: shes rab sgom ste /
analyzed: shes rab sgom ste /
translated: and cultivate wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab bsgom yang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab bsgom yang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: When cultivating wisdom in this way, they do not conceptualize or form mental images of it.

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not pay attention to whether it is a real thing or not.

original: gang shes rab de la sgom pa de'ang /🔽mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang shes rab de la sgom pa de'ang / mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: They do not apprehend the cultivation of wisdom.🔽They do not see it as a mental image or as an object.

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not pay attention to whether it is a real thing or not.

original: sems can gang gi don du shes rab de la sgom pa de dag la'ang mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can gang gi don du shes rab de la sgom pa de dag la'ang mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: They do not mentally construct it as existent or

original: dngos po yod pa'am /🔽dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am / dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: nonexistent.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran @207b pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran @207b pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang /
translated: They do not apprehend the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-things, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of the nature of non-entities, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the aspects of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: he does not think about that knowledge of all aspects, does not make a sign of it,🔽and does not pay attention to it as an existent thing

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: or as a nonexistent thing.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: Up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he does not think about it, does not make a sign of it,🔽and does not pay attention to it as an existent thing

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: or as a nonexistent thing.”

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de /🔽dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de la'ang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed de / dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: He does not think about, does not form mental images of, the one who fully awakens to enlightenment, the one who fully awakens to enlightenment in regard to, and the one who fully awakens to enlightenment by means of.🔽He does not pay attention to anything as existent or

original: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: nonexistent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /🔽de dag sangs @208a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de / de dag sangs @208a *//
translated: Because all phenomena are essentially nonexistent.

original: rgyas rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad /
analyzed: rgyas rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad /
translated: They are not created by the Buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang ma byas te /
translated: nor by the Pratyekabuddhas, nor by the Arhats,🔽nor by the Bodhisattvas, nor by the gods,🔽nor by Māra, nor by Brahmā.

original: chos thams cad ni byed pa po med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byed pa po med pa /
translated: All phenomena are devoid of an agent.

original: byed pa po dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are devoid of an agent and a feeler.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags na /
analyzed: de lta lags na /
translated: if that is the case,

original: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /
translated: are phenomena separated from phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just so,

original: rab 'byor / chos rnams ni chos rnams nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos rnams ni chos rnams nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: Subhūti, phenomena are separated from phenomena.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags na /
translated: if phenomena are separated from phenomena in that way,

original: ji ltar chos kyis chos la dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyis chos la dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: how can one know that a phenomenon has a real basis or

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur /
translated: that it does not have a real basis?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ste /
translated: a non-existent phenomenon cannot know a non-existent phenomenon,

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: and an existent phenomenon cannot know an existent phenomenon.🔽A non-existent phenomenon cannot know an existent phenomenon,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //🔽dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //🔽dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: and an existent phenomenon cannot know a non-existent phenomenon.

original: de ltar chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal bar ma mchis pas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal bar ma mchis pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are not fully understood in that way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lta dngos po mchis pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lta dngos po mchis pa'am /
translated: how could a bodhisattva great being think of an existent thing🔽or a nonexistent thing?

original: dngos po ma mchis par sems par yang ga la @208b 'gyur; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis par sems par yang ga la @208b 'gyur; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nye bar bzung bas /🔽dngos po yod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nye bar bzung bas / dngos po yod ces bya ba'am /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they teach that things exist or

original: dngos po med ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya bar ston te /
translated: that things do not exist in terms of the conventional truth of the world,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the ultimate.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: ci lags / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: are the conventional truth of the world and

original: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
analyzed: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
translated: the ultimate truth different?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: “Subhūti, the conventional truth of the world and

original: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba'ang med de /
analyzed: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba'ang med de /
translated: Nor is there any other ultimate.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin yang /
translated: The suchness of the world’s convention is itself the suchness of the ultimate.

original: de la sems can de dag phyin ci log tu gyur pas de bzhin nyid de mi shes mi mthong ste /🔽de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos po yod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la sems can de dag phyin ci log tu gyur pas de bzhin nyid de mi shes mi mthong ste / de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos po yod ces bya ba'am /
translated: But sentient beings, who have become distorted, do not know or see that suchness.

original: dngos po med ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: For their sake, bodhisattva great beings, using the world’s convention, say that things exist or that things do not exist.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang sems can gang ji snyed cig phung po lnga la dngos po yod pa'i 'du shes su gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang sems can gang ji snyed cig phung po lnga la dngos po yod pa'i 'du shes su gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: for as many sentient beings as there are who have the idea that the five aggregates exist and do not know that they do not exist,

original: dngos po med par mi shes pa de dag gi don du chos rnams rab tu dbye ba nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med par mi shes pa de dag gi don du chos rnams rab tu dbye ba nye bar bzung ste /
translated: for their sake, using a categorization of phenomena,

original: dngos po med par yang ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: dngos po med par yang ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhes te /
translated: they say, ‘How can they know that things do not exist?’

original: de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du brjod do //
translated: and they say that.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol @209a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol @209a *//
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: Subhuti, the great being, should practice the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: le'u lnga bcu bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu bzhi pa'o ////
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, Chapter Fifty-Four

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa /
translated: Lord,🔽'bodhisattva practice,'

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi na /🔽de skad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi ba de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi na / de skad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi ba de /
translated: 'bodhisattva practice' -

original: gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
analyzed: gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
translated: what is the meaning of the words 'bodhisattva practice'?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:🔽Subhuti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa /
translated: 'bodhisattva practice,'

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: 'bodhisattva practice' -

original: de byang chub kyi don du spyod pas na /
analyzed: de byang chub kyi don du spyod pas na /
translated: because he practices for the sake of enlightenment,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the bodhisattva practice.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la spyod pa lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ practice?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
translated: “They practice ‘form is empty.’

original: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
translated: They practice in such a way that their mind does not become dualistic.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
translated: They practice ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.’

original: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
translated: They practice in such a way that their mind does not become dualistic.

original: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
analyzed: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
translated: They practice ‘the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are empty.’

original: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
translated: They practice in such a way that their mind does not become dualistic.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @209b tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @209b tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom as ‘empty.’

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: They engage with inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature as ‘empty.’

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: They engage with the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are empty.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: They practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path are empty.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: They practice the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the meditative absorption of emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de @210a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de @210a *//
translated: the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signlessness meditative stabilization, the wishlessness meditative stabilization, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are empty.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang; spobs pa dang / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang; spobs pa dang / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: The purification of a buddhafield, the bringing about of beings’ maturation, eloquence, and the accomplishment of letters are empty.

original: yi ge la 'jug pa dang / yi ge med pa la 'jug pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: yi ge la 'jug pa dang / yi ge med pa la 'jug pa stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: The engagement with letters and the engagement with the absence of letters are empty.

original: gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar spyod /
translated: Form is empty.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong pa zhes bya bar spyod de /
translated: and the empty element of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /🔽bam po drug cu gnyis pa /
analyzed: ci nas kyang blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa / bam po drug cu gnyis pa /
translated: He practices in such a way that his mind does not proceed in two ways.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni byang chub tu spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni byang chub tu spyod pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that, they practice for awakening.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Therefore it is called the practice of a bodhisattva.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sangs rgyas / sangs rgyas zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sangs rgyas / sangs rgyas zhes bgyi na /
translated: “Lord,🔽buddha,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
translated: buddha—what is the referent of the word ‘buddha’?🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @210b bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @210b bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Subhuti: The meaning of reality is the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar des yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar des yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Subhuti: It is because he has fully known the real Dharma that

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //

original: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pas /
translated: Subhuti: It is because he has fully known the real meaning that

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar des chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar des chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Subhuti: It is because he has fully known all dharmas as they really are that

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called Buddha.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhuti: Lord,

analyzed: byang chub byang chub ces bgyi na /

original: byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: what is the meaning of the word 'enlightenment'?

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags lags so //
translated: The Lord: Subhuti, 'enlightenment' is a word for emptiness.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is a word for the reality-limit.

original: 'di ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: 'di ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: This is the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, the nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality.

original: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar byang chub ces bya ba de ni /

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and the suchness that is not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

translated: ‘awakening’ is just a name and a label.

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called ‘awakening.’

original: rab 'byor / @211a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @211a *//

analyzed: yang 'di ltar yang dag pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don to //
translated: it is like this: the true meaning is the meaning of awakening.

original: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa ste; de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa ste; de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is because it is the realization that all dharmas are mere names and signs that it is called ‘awakening.’

analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar dbyer med pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don to //

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / yang 'di ltar de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because it is fully awakened to by the lord buddhas

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: that it is called ‘awakening.’

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

translated: “What are the roots of virtue that are accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or that arise or cease,🔽or that are afflicted or purified,🔽in the practice of the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience?”🔽The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, the roots of virtue that are accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or that arise or cease,🔽or that are afflicted or purified,🔽in the practice of the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience,🔽are not accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or do not arise or cease,🔽or are not afflicted or purified.🔽Why is that?🔽Subhūti, it is because the roots of virtue that are accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or that arise or cease,🔽or that are afflicted or purified,🔽in the practice of the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience,🔽are not roots of virtue.🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not roots of virtue that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or do not arise or cease,🔽or are not afflicted or purified,🔽that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not roots of virtue that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or do not arise or cease,🔽or are not afflicted or purified,🔽that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not roots of virtue that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or do not arise or cease,🔽or are not afflicted or purified,🔽that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not roots of virtue that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not accumulated,🔽diminished, or increased,🔽or do not arise or cease,🔽or are not afflicted or purified,🔽that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhūti, it is because they are not roots of virtue that they are called ‘roots of virtue.’🔽Subhū
