analyzed: 'gag par bya ba'am /
translated: cessation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am /🔽rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir de dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am / rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir de dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: affliction, or🔽purification of any dharma.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: de ltar gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni /
analyzed: de ltar gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni /
translated: if the awakening of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos gang yang tshogs su 'gyur ba'am /🔽'grib par bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang tshogs su 'gyur ba'am / 'grib par bgyi ba'am /
translated: is not present as an object for the accumulation,🔽decrease,

original: 'gong bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: 'gong bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: diminution,

original: 'phel bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: 'phel bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: increase,

original: skye bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: skye bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: arising,🔽cessation,

original: 'gag par bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: 'gag par bgyi ba'am /
translated: to stop,🔽🔽

original: kun nas nyon mongs par bgyi ba'am /🔽rnam par byang bar bgyi ba'i slad du /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par bgyi ba'am / rnam par byang bar bgyi ba'i slad du /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma lags na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma lags na /
translated: if it is not the case that it is present in the manner of an objective support,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: 'o na de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: then how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: take up the perfection of generosity?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par @212b 'gyur; ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par @212b 'gyur; ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: How will they take up the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom? How will they practice inner emptiness,

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: and how will they practice up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: How will they practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of supernormal ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: How will they practice the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete liberations, the states of composure, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: wishlessness, the higher cognitions, the meditative absorptions, and the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: How will they practice the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: How will they practice the ten bodhisattva stages?

original: ji ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: How will they transcend the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How will they enter into the bodhisattvas’ faultless state?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni gnyis su spyod pa'i blo med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni gnyis su spyod pa'i blo med de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings do not have a dualistic mind.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //🔽gnyis kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i @213a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do // gnyis kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i @213a *//
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings do not practice the transcendent perfection of generosity dualistically.🔽They do not practice the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline,🔽the transcendent perfection of tolerance,🔽the transcendent perfection of perseverance,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom dualistically.

original: gnyis kyis nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
translated: “They do not practice the emptiness of internal phenomena as two, nor do they practice the emptiness of internal phenomena as not two.

original: gnyis kyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, as two, nor do they practice them as not two.

original: gnyis kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mi spyod do //🔽gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mi spyod do // gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang /
translated: “They do not practice the applications of mindfulness as two, nor do they practice them as not two. Similarly, they do not practice the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, or the noble eightfold path as two, nor do they practice them as not two.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mi spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mi spyod do //

original: gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mi spyod do //
translated: and with two, he does not practice the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the buddhadharmas.

original: gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
translated: and with two, he does not practice up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: if, with two, he does not practice the perfection of giving,

original: gnyis kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @213b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: gnyis kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @213b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: with two, he does not practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: gnyis kyis stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mi spyod /
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mi spyod /
translated: with two, he does not practice all the emptinesses and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: they do not practice the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the serial absorptions, emptiness,🔽signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mi spyod /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mi spyod /
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways;

original: gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod na /
analyzed: gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod na /
translated: and they do not practice up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'o na de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur bas /
translated: “Well then, how do bodhisattva great beings increase their wholesome roots?

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Starting from the first production of the thought,

original: sems slad ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems slad ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: and until the arising of the next thought, they will increase through many roots of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / su gang gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / su gang gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, those who practice dualistically will not increase their roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni gnyis la brten pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni gnyis la brten pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all foolish ordinary beings rely on duality,

original: de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par mi 'phel lo //
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par mi 'phel lo //
translated: and they do not increase their roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnyis la mi spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnyis la mi spyod de /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings do not practice dualistically.

original: de ni @214a *//
analyzed: de ni @214a *//
translated: They

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening

original: sems phyi ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: sems phyi ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel te /
translated: until the arising of the next thought, increase their roots of virtue.🔽The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot diminish their roots of virtue

original: de ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis nyams smad pas /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis nyams smad pas /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: with any nonvirtuous act.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: they will fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,🔽or they will be carried away by other unwholesome dharmas,

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gyis yongs su 'phrog par gyur cing; de dag gis yongs su phrogs pas /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gyis yongs su 'phrog par gyur cing; de dag gis yongs su phrogs pas /
translated: and, being carried away by them,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: when they practice the perfection of giving,🔽they will not grow through many wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and when they practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na /
translated: they will not grow through many wholesome roots, and when they practice inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the seven branches of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod na /
translated: and the noble eightfold path,🔽they will not increase their roots of virtue.🔽If they practice the noble truths,🔽the concentrations,🔽the immeasurables,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par @214b 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par @214b 'jug pa dang /
translated: the formless absorptions,🔽the deliverances,🔽the sequential meditative absorptions,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la spyod na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la spyod na /
translated: the clairvoyances,🔽the meditative stabilities,🔽and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la spyod na /
translated: and if they practice the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽they will not increase their wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na /
translated: Up to if they practice the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba de ltar nyams smad par mi nus te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba de ltar nyams smad par mi nus te /
translated: they will not increase their wholesome roots.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,🔽is it for the sake of wholesome roots

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du /
translated: that bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”🔽“Subhūti, it is not for the sake of wholesome roots

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi'am /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi'am /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: that bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is not so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //🔽mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do // mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of wholesome roots.🔽They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of unwholesome roots.

original: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod de /
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod de /
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of wholesome or unwholesome roots.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who have not attended to the blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis yongs su ma bzung bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @215a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis yongs su ma bzung bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @215a *//
translated: who have not completed the wholesome roots,

original: nyid thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: nyid thob par mi nus so //
translated: and who have not been taken up by spiritual friends are unable to attain omniscience.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings who have attended to the lord buddhas, who have been taken hold of by wholesome roots, and who have been taken hold of by spiritual friends attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here, starting from the first production of the thought,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: bodhisattva great beings attend on the lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
translated: Those lord buddhas teach them the discourses, melodious narrations, predictions, verses, summaries, introductions, benificent stories, former events, former lives, extensive teachings,

original: chos rmad du byung ba dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab pa bstan pa gang ci gsungs kyang de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos rmad du byung ba dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab pa bstan pa gang ci gsungs kyang de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: whatever the Dharma teachings that are spoken, whether marvelous or not, whether in verse or prose, whether they are of the Sūtra class or the class of the Vinaya or the class of the Abhidharma, whether they are of the śrāvakas, or of the pratyekabuddhas, or of the bodhisattvas, or of the tathāgatas, he retains them all.

original: yongs su bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su dris pa dang / yid kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / lta bas rab tu khong du chud par byas shing gzungs rab tu thob par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su dris pa dang / yid kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / lta bas rab tu khong du chud par byas shing gzungs rab tu thob par byed do //
translated: Having retained them, he asks questions about them with his speech, examines them with his mind, and penetrates them with his view, and he attains retention.

original: gzungs rab tu thob nas /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu skyed do //
analyzed: gzungs rab tu thob nas / so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu skyed do //
translated: Having attained retention,🔽he gives rise to the analytical knowledges.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa skyes pas /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa skyes pas /
translated: Having given rise to the analytical knowledges,

original: de tshe rnam par 'phos kyang /
analyzed: de tshe rnam par 'phos kyang /
translated: even if he were to pass away at that time,

original: chos de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @215b par gyur gyi bar du nam yang chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @215b par gyur gyi bar du nam yang chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: those dharmas will not be lost until he has attained the knowledge of all modes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing /
translated: He plants wholesome roots with those tathāgatas, those arhats, those fully enlightened Buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung na /
translated: If they are embraced by those wholesome roots,

original: nam yang ngan song dang mi khom par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang ngan song dang mi khom par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be reborn in the lower realms or in the unfavorable states.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang lus yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin te /🔽lus de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang lus yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin te / lus de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: Those wholesome roots will also embrace a pure body,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: and with that body they will purify a buddhafield and bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung bas kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung bas kyang /
translated: And because they are embraced by those wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i legs pa ston pa dag dang nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i legs pa ston pa dag dang nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be separated from the spiritual benefactors, the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, and those who teach the good of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bar bya'o //
translated: I will serve the lord buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will plant wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la brten par bya'o //
translated: I will rely on spiritual friends.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu lnga pa'o ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu lnga pa'o //// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: this was chapter fifty-five.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang bsnyen bkur mi bgyid /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su @216a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang bsnyen bkur mi bgyid / dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su @216a *//
translated: do not serve the lord buddhas,

original: rdzogs par mi bgyid la /
analyzed: rdzogs par mi bgyid la /
translated: do not complete wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma bzung bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma bzung bar gyur na /
translated: and are not taken hold of by spiritual friends,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: will those bodhisattva great beings not attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis /
translated: “Subhūti, it is impossible for a bodhisattva great being

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
translated: who has not served the blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
translated: who has not completed the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and who has not been taken up by a spiritual friend to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur yang byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur yang byas /
translated: Even if they have served the blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: completed the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la'ang brten pa byas kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la'ang brten pa byas kyang /
translated: and relied on a spiritual friend,

original: da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
analyzed: da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
translated: they still cannot attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
translated: So how could those who have not served the blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
translated: have not completed the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma brten pa rnams /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma brten pa rnams /
translated: and have not relied on a spiritual friend

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: how much more so for the attainment of the knowledge of all modes!

original: de ni gnas med do //🔽rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ming bden pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /🔽sangs rgyas bcom @216b ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do // rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ming bden pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas / sangs rgyas bcom @216b ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o // dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par bya'o //
translated: That is not possible.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to stand in the true nature of dharmas, who wants to go forth to the knowledge of all modes, should wait on the Buddhas, the Lords, should plant wholesome roots, and should keep company with good friends.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bgyis kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bgyis kyang /
translated: Subhuti: Why is it, O Lord, that the Bodhisattva, the great being, although he has waited on the Buddhas, the Lords, has planted wholesome roots, and has kept company with good friends,🔽nevertheless does not go forth to the knowledge of all modes?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: they will not attain the knowledge of all modes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: de ni thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not endowed with skill in means.

original: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de dag thob par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de dag thob par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: They have not obtained from those Buddhas, those Lords that skill in means.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu'ang ma bskyed /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu'ang ma bskyed /
translated: They have not planted the wholesome roots.

original: gang de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu dag la'ang ma brten pas de ltar thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu dag la'ang ma brten pas de ltar thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They have not attended on the spiritual friends who could have taught them that skill in means.🔽Subhuti: What is that skill in means through which the Bodhisattvas,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: the great beings, attain the knowledge of all modes?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, from the first thought of enlightenment onward,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: When practicing the perfection of generosity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
translated: with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / mi dang mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /🔽de rnam pa thams cad @217a *//🔽mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / mi dang mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste / de rnam pa thams cad @217a *// mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dang ldan pas /
translated: they give gifts to the lord buddhas, the pratyekabuddhas, the śrāvakas, and humans and nonhumans,

original: sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /🔽len pa la'ang len pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur / len pa la'ang len pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
translated: and they do not consider that they are giving gifts,🔽that they are giving to those,🔽or that they are giving anything at all.🔽They do not consider that they are giving gifts,🔽that they are giving to those,

original: gtong ba la'ang gtong ba'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtong ba la'ang gtong ba'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that they are giving anything at all.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong zhing /
translated: and they see that all phenomena are nonexistent, do not arise, are not complete, and are not actualized.

original: chos rnams kyis mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyis mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: “Although they engage with the characteristics of phenomena,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: they engage with the characteristic of the absence of conditioning, thinking, ‘All phenomena are powerless.’

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: “Endowed with such skillful means, they practice the perfection of generosity while increasing their roots of virtue.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
translated: While practicing the perfection of generosity, they bring sentient beings to maturity and refine the buddhafields.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: Except for bringing sentient beings to maturity and protecting them, they do not wish for any other result of generosity that would be enjoyed in saṃsāra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines says:🔽🔽

original: le'u lnga bcu drug pa'o;; ;;rab 'byor /
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu drug pa'o;; ;;rab 'byor /
translated: This was the fifty-sixth chapter, “Perfection of Wisdom,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung @217b ste; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /🔽tshul khrims bsrung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung @217b ste; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas / tshul khrims bsrung ste /
translated: from the time when they first begin setting their mind out on the Great Vehicle until they are seated at the site of awakening, they should guard morality with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: They should guard morality without being obscured by a mind of desire,

original: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: without being obscured by a mind of hatred,🔽without being obscured by a mind of delusion,

original: gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur; bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur; bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: without being obscured by a latent tendency,

original: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and without being obscured by a manifest tendency.

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: They should guard morality without being obscured by other nonvirtuous dharmas that are obstacles to awakening,🔽such as stinginess,

original: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
translated: bad morality,🔽a disturbed mind,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
translated: laziness,

original: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
translated: a weak mind,

original: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
translated: a distracted mind,

original: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems sam /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems sam /
translated: a mind of bad wisdom,

original: nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga rgyal lam /
translated: pride,🔽contempt,

original: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: pride in being great,

original: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: pride in being me,

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: a śrāvaka mind,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or a pratyekabuddha mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because they know that all things are empty of their own defining characteristics,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
translated: and they see that all things are nonexistent, unarisen, incomplete, and unactualized.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: Although they engage with the defining characteristics of things,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: they engage with the defining characteristics of all things through the defining characteristic of the absence of formative predispositions, thinking, ‘All things are completely without any capacity at all.’

original: de thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: They practice the perfection of morality while increasing their wholesome roots.

original: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: While practicing the perfection of morality,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they bring beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed @218a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed @218a *//
translated: and purify a buddhafield.

original: kyang; gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: kyang; gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the sake of protecting all beings and bringing beings to maturity,

original: tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: they do not aspire to any fruit of morality that they might enjoy in cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of patience,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the time they first begin setting their mind out on the Great Vehicle

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas bzod pa bsgom ste /🔽de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas bzod pa bsgom ste / de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: They cultivate patience with a mind endowed with omniscience.🔽They are not obscured by a mind of desire.

original: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur / gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur / bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: They are not obscured by a mind of anger.🔽They are not obscured by a mind of delusion.🔽They are not obscured by latent tendencies.

original: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not obscured by the arising of afflictions.🔽They are not obscured by any other nonvirtuous phenomena

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gang byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gang byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba /
translated: that are obstacles to awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,🔽they are not obscured by stinginess,

original: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
translated: by faulty morality,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems sam / le lo'i sems sam /
translated: by a disturbed mind,🔽by a lazy mind,

original: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /🔽g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam / g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
translated: by a weak mind,🔽by a distracted mind,

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam /🔽nga rgyal lam /🔽brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam / nga rgyal lam / brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: by a confused mind,🔽by pride,🔽by contempt,

original: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: by the pride of thinking “I am,”

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: by the thought of a śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or by the thought of a pratyekabuddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs @218b pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs @218b pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
translated: and they see that all phenomena are nonexistent, non-arisen, not fully complete, and not truly accomplished.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: When they engage with the marks of phenomena,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: they engage with the mark of the absence of conditioning, thinking, ‘All phenomena are completely without any ability.’

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: they practice the perfection of patience while increasing their roots of virtue.

original: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: While practicing the perfection of patience,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they bring sentient beings to full maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
translated: and purify a buddha realm.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, he would not practice the perfection of patience for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par bzod pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par bzod pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: He would not be without aspiration for the fruit of patience that he would enjoy in cyclic existence, except for the fruit of patience that he would enjoy in cyclic existence for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the time when they first begin setting their mind out on it

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: they apply perseverance with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: In that, a thought of attachment does not obscure it,

original: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur / gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: a thought of aversion does not obscure it,🔽a thought of confusion does not obscure it,

original: bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: a latent tendency does not obscure it,

original: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: and a full entanglements does not obscure it.

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba /
translated: and other unwholesome dharmas that would be an obstacle to awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽avarice,

original: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
translated: immoral conduct,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems sam / le lo'i sems sam /
translated: an agitated mind,🔽a lazy mind,

original: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
translated: a mind of little perseverance,

original: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /🔽shes rab 'chal @219a *//
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems sam / shes rab 'chal @219a *//
translated: a distracted mind,

original: pa'i sems sam /🔽nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: pa'i sems sam / nga rgyal lam /
translated: a mind of bad wisdom,🔽pride,🔽contempt,

original: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: pride in being great,

original: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: pride in being me,

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: a śrāvaka mind,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or a pratyekabuddha mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they know that all dharmas are empty of their own marks,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
translated: and they see that all dharmas are nonexistent, non-arisen, not fully complete, and not manifestly perfect.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: Even though they engage with the marks of dharmas,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: He engages with the knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of any capacity, through the knowledge that conditioned things are characterized by absence of production.

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: he practices the perfection of effort, increasing his wholesome actions.

original: de brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: While practicing the perfection of effort,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: he brings beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
translated: and refines the buddha-field,🔽but not for the sake of any result.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Except for the sake of protecting all beings and bringing them to maturity,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
translated: he does not practice the perfection of effort for the sake of any result.

original: brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu gang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu gang /
translated: What result does he not seek?

original: 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med de //
analyzed: 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med de //
translated: He does not seek any result that would be enjoyed in cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of concentration,

original: sems dang @219b po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang @219b po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the first production of the thought

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
translated: up to the point where they have attained the cognition of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: they enter into the concentrations.🔽In that state, their minds are not obscured by attachment,

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur; zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur; zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: they are not obscured by aversion,

original: gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur / bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: they are not obscured by delusion,🔽they are not obscured by latent tendencies,

original: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and they are not obscured by manifest afflictions.

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not have any other nonvirtuous qualities that would obstruct awakening,🔽such as stinginess,

original: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
translated: bad moral discipline,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems sam / le lo'i sems sam /
translated: an agitated mind,🔽a lazy mind,

original: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
translated: a mind of little perseverance,

original: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
translated: a distracted mind,

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam /
translated: or a mind of poor understanding.

original: nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga rgyal lam /
translated: They do not have pride,

original: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: or contempt, or pride,

original: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: or pride in thinking “I am,”

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: or the thought of a śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or the thought of a pratyekabuddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
translated: and they see that all phenomena are nonexistent, do not arise, are not complete, and are not accomplished.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: And when they engage with the marks of phenomena,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: they engage with the mark of the absence of conditioning, thinking, ‘All phenomena are completely without any ability.’

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel ba de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel ba de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: they practice the perfection of meditative absorption while increasing their wholesome roots.

original: de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the perfection of concentration

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: and bring beings to maturity.

original: @220a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
analyzed: @220a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
translated: They refine the buddhafields,🔽but not for the sake of any result,

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: except for the sake of protecting all beings and bringing beings to maturity.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
translated: They practice the perfection of concentration

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyod par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyod par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: without hoping for any result that would be enjoyed in saṃsāra.

original: rab 'byor // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: starting from the first production of the thought,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas shes rab bsgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas shes rab bsgom ste /
translated: they cultivate wisdom with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: In this, the mind of attachment is not obscured,

original: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur / gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: the mind of aversion is not obscured,🔽the mind of delusion is not obscured,

original: bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: the mind of latent tendencies is not obscured,

original: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba sgrib par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the mind of agitation is not obscured,

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan byang chub kyi bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: and other nonvirtuous dharmas that are obstacles to awakening, such as🔽miserliness,

original: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'am /
translated: the mind of immorality,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems sam /🔽le lo'i sems sam /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems sam / le lo'i sems sam /
translated: the mind of laziness,

original: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung ba'i sems sam /
translated: the mind of little diligence,

original: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems sam /
translated: the mind of distraction,

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam /🔽nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i sems sam / nga rgyal lam /
translated: the mind of poor wisdom,🔽pride,🔽contempt,

original: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: brnyas pa'am / che ba'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: the pride of superiority,

original: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: nga'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: the pride of “I am,”

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: the mind of śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag kyang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the mind of pratyekabuddhas are not obscured.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams @220b cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams @220b cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they know that all dharmas are empty of their own marks.

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /
translated: They see all phenomena as nonexistent, as not arisen, as not complete, and as not manifestly perfect.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang /
translated: Even when they engage with the characteristics of phenomena,

original: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nus pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: they engage with the characteristic of the absence of formation, thinking, ‘All phenomena are devoid of any capacity.’

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom while increasing their roots of virtue.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: While practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they bring sentient beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed kyang /
translated: and refine the buddhafields.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, they do so only in order to protect all sentient beings and bring them to maturity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyad par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: he does not aspire to any result of wisdom that he would enjoy in cyclic existence.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu bdun pa'o ////
translated: this is chapter fifty-seven.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who enter into the first concentration, who enter into the second concentration, who enter into the third concentration, who enter into the fourth concentration,

original: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang /
translated: who enter into the immeasurables and the formless absorptions,

original: de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: do not appropriate their fruitions.

original: de @221a *// ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de @221a *// ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: In this way, they are skilled in means.

original: thabs mkhas pa des bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes so //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa des bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes so //
translated: With that skill in means, they know that those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions are empty of their own marks.

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par shes so //
translated: They know that all phenomena are nonexistent, non-arisen, non-ceased, and non-afflicted.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba'i lam la spyod kyang; rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba'i lam la spyod kyang; rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed /
translated: with skill in means practice the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, but do not attain the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi byed /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi byed /
translated: do not attain the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, or the state of a worthy one,
