original: mtshan ma gang dang gang gis lam du brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma gang dang gang gis lam du brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: and the signs by which the path is described. Those aspects, those modes, and those signs are to be manifestly and perfectly awakened to by bodhisattva great beings, and having manifestly and perfectly awakened to them,

original: ci nas kyang gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur pa dang / gzhan 'dul ba'i don du gzhan la brjod pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / gdags pa dang / rnam par dgod pa ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur pa dang / gzhan 'dul ba'i don du gzhan la brjod pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / gdags pa dang / rnam par dgod pa ste /
translated: they are to be taught, explained, designated, and presented to others so that others will understand them and so that others will be guided.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra brnyan lta bur shes par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra brnyan lta bur shes par bya ba'i don du /
translated: “In this regard, bodhisattva great beings should understand the meaning of the analogy of an echo.

original: sgra skad dang brdar bya ba gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su go bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sgra skad dang brda thams cad brjod par bya /🔽yongs su gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgra skad dang brdar bya ba gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su go bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sgra skad dang brda thams cad brjod par bya / yongs su gzung bar bya ste /
translated: “By whatever sounds and signs the great billionfold world system would be made to resound, all those sounds and signs should be uttered and should be taken up.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, for this reason also bodhisattva great beings should complete all the paths.

original: lam thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: lam thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed the knowledge of all the paths,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rig par bya ste /
translated: they should know the thoughts of all beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the path of the beings in the hells,

original: rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: they should know the cause,

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
translated: they should know the result,

original: des kyang sems can dmyal ba'i lam bzlog par bya ste /🔽rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang sems can dmyal ba'i lam bzlog par bya ste / rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: and they should turn them away from the path of the hells.🔽They should turn them away from the cause,

original: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: and they should turn them away from the result.

original: byol song gi skye gnas kyi sems can rnams kyi byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam @232a *//🔽shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas kyi sems can rnams kyi byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam @232a *// shes par bya'o //
translated: “They should know the path of the animal realm of the beings in the animal realm.

original: rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the cause.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the result.

original: des kyang byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam bzlog par bya ste /
translated: They should turn away from the path of the animal realm.

original: rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: They should turn away from the cause.

original: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: They should turn away from the result.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
translated: “They should know the path of the world of the Lord of Death of the beings in the world of the Lord of Death.

original: rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the cause.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the result.

original: des kyang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: They should turn away from the path of the world of the Lord of Death.

original: rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: They should turn away from the cause.

original: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: They should turn away from the result.

original: mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / mi dang / lha dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / mi dang / lha dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
translated: “They should know the path of the kinnaras, the mahoragas, the nāgas, the yakṣas, the humans, the devas, and Brahmā.

original: rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: “One should know the causes.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //🔽kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang; 'bras bu che ba'i rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams dang / mi che ba'i lha rnams dang / mi gdung ba'i lha rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o // kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang; 'bras bu che ba'i rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams dang / mi che ba'i lha rnams dang / mi gdung ba'i lha rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams dang /
translated: One should know the results.🔽“One should know the path of the gods of the Brahma realm, the gods of the radiance of the Brahma realm, the gods of limited radiance, the gods of unlimited radiance, the gods of the highest radiance, the gods of the cloudless realm, the gods of the realm of merit, the gods of great fruit, the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the gods of the great result, the gods of no affliction, the gods of excellent vision,

original: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
translated: the gods of universal purity, and the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: “One should know the causes.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the results.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi lam shes par bya'o //
translated: “One should know the path of the gods of the sphere of infinite space, the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the gods of the sphere of nothingness, and the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: @232b rgyu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @232b rgyu shes par bya'o //
translated: “One should know the causes.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the results.🔽“

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the four noble truths.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang; bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang; bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the three doors of liberation, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, and the nine serial absorptions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the ten powers of the Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, great love, and great compassion.

original: lam de dag gis kyang sems can gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: lam de dag gis kyang sems can gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: By means of these paths, those beings who should be established in the fruit of entering the stream,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god /
translated: he establishes in the fruit of entering the stream.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who should be established in the fruit of the once-returner,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god /
translated: he establishes in the fruit of the once-returner.

original: gang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who should be established in the fruit of the non-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god /
translated: he establishes in the fruit of the non-returner.

original: gang dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who should be established in the state of arhat,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god /
translated: he establishes in the state of arhat.

original: gang rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who should be established in individual enlightenment,

original: rang byang chub @233a *//🔽la 'god / gang byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: rang byang chub @233a *// la 'god / gang byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: to the pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽and those who are to be established in awakening,

original: byang chub la 'god do //
analyzed: byang chub la 'god do //
translated: he establishes them in awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: “Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ knowledge of path aspects.

original: de dag la bslabs shing /
analyzed: de dag la bslabs shing /
translated: Having trained in them,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la 'jug go /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings penetrate the thoughts of beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la zhugs nas de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la zhugs nas de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having penetrated the thoughts of beings, they teach the Dharma accordingly.

original: des chos bstan pa de'ang 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos bstan pa de'ang 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that Dharma teaching of theirs does not go to waste.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar des gzhan gyi dbang po shin tu shes par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des gzhan gyi dbang po shin tu shes par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because they have well understood the faculties of others.

original: de ni sems can rnams kyi lam dang / lam ma yin pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams kyi lam dang / lam ma yin pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the paths and not paths, and the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya ste /
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva should practice the perfection of wisdom like this.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir ni /
translated: In this perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs gang la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs gang la /
translated: there is nothing of the factors of awakening

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'am /
translated: that the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva should train in,

original: nyan thos kyis bslab par bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bslab par bya ba'am /
translated: or that the śrāvakas should train in,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis bslab par bya ba'i chos thams cad gang yang ma 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis bslab par bya ba'i chos thams cad gang yang ma 'dus pa med do //
translated: or that the pratyekabuddhas should train in—there is nothing that is not included.🔽Subhuti said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang lags pa dang / byang chub gang lags pa'i chos de dag thams cad ldan pa'ang ma lags /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang lags pa dang / byang chub gang lags pa'i chos de dag thams cad ldan pa'ang ma lags / mi ldan pa'ang ma lags /
translated: if it is so that the factors of awakening and awakening are all dharmas that are neither conjoined nor disjoined,

original: gzugs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis pa /
translated: are formless,

original: @233b bstan du ma mchis pa /
analyzed: @233b bstan du ma mchis pa /
translated: cannot be pointed out,

original: thogs pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: are without differentiation,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig na /
translated: and have only one mark—that is, no mark—

original: ji ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams byang chub sgrub par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams byang chub sgrub par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How do the dharmas on the side of awakening bring about the attainment of awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ldan pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ldan pa'ang ma lags /
translated: Blessed One,🔽they are not conjoined

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags la /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags la /
translated: and they are not disjoined;

original: gzugs ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis shing /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du ma mchis /
analyzed: bstan du ma mchis /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: thogs pa ma mchis /
translated: are unimpeded,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par /🔽mtshan nyid gcig pa ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par / mtshan nyid gcig pa ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
translated: and are like this because they are without defining characteristics.

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so //
translated: A single defining characteristic does not bring about the attainment or destruction of any dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am 'jig par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am 'jig par mi bgyid do //
translated: space does not bring about the attainment or destruction of any dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos ni /🔽chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos ni / chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
translated: in the same way, a dharma that is empty of its own defining characteristics

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so //
translated: does not bring about the attainment or destruction of any dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos ni chos gang la'ang sgrub pa'am /
translated: A phenomenon that is empty of its own mark does not establish or

original: 'jig par byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa med do //
translated: destroy any phenomenon at all.

original: rab 'byor / sems can gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos mi shes pa de dag gi don du 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos mi shes pa de dag gi don du 'di skad du /
translated: Su­bhūti, for the benefit of those sentient beings who do not understand that phenomena are empty of their own marks, it is said,

original: 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos byang chub thob par byed pa'o zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos byang chub thob par byed pa'o zhes bshad kyi /
translated: ‘These are the attributes of enlightenment that cause the attainment of enlightenment.’🔽Su­bhūti, it is because physical forms,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, consciousness, the sensory elements, the sense fields, and dependent origination,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol @234a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol @234a *//
translated: the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative stabilization, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po gang yin pa dang /
translated: inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature; the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa gang yin pa dang / byams pa gang yin pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa gang yin pa dang / byams pa gang yin pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang yin pa dang /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception, the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of manifestation, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the three gateways to liberation,

original: @234b rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: @234b rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the eight deliverances, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos dang 'dul ba 'di la ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos dang 'dul ba 'di la ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, great love, great compassion, and all the qualities up to omniscience are not present in this Dharma and Vinaya,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor are they absent.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: They are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig kyang /
translated: and are of a single mark—that is, no mark.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis de skad du brjod de /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis de skad du brjod de /
translated: The Tathāgata has described them in that way in order to help sentient beings understand them, using worldly conventions,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes pa dang / mthong bas bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes pa dang / mthong bas bslab par bya ste /
translated: “All of those should be learned by bodhisattva great beings through knowledge and seeing.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / mthong bas bslabs nas /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / mthong bas bslabs nas /
translated: Having learned them through knowledge and seeing as they are,

original: chos la la ni mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: chos la la ni mngon du bya'o //
translated: Some dharmas are to be realized.

original: la la ni mngon du mi bya'o //
analyzed: la la ni mngon du mi bya'o //
translated: Some dharmas are not to be realized.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang ni shes pa dang / mthong bas bslabs te mngon du bya'o /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang ni shes pa dang / mthong bas bslabs te mngon du bya'o /
translated: “Here, what dharmas are to be realized by the bodhisattva great beings through training in knowledge and seeing?

original: chos gang ni mngon du mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang ni mngon du mi bya zhe na /
translated: What dharmas are not to be realized?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni shes pa dang mthong bas bslabs te mngon du mi bya'o //🔽rnam pa @235a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni shes pa dang mthong bas bslabs te mngon du mi bya'o // rnam pa @235a *//
translated: The dharmas of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are not to be realized through training in knowledge and seeing.🔽All dharmas are to be realized through the knowledge of the knowledge of a knower of paths.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon du bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon du bya ste /
translated: All dharmas are to be realized in all ways through the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phags pa'i chos dang / 'dul ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phags pa'i chos dang / 'dul ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way in the noble Dharma and Vinaya.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,🔽what is the noble Dharma and Vinaya?

original: 'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba zhes bgyi ba de ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba zhes bgyi ba de ji tsam gyis na /
translated: What is meant by ‘noble Dharma and Vinaya’?

original: 'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos dang 'dul ba zhes bgyi /
translated: What is meant by the Dharma and Vinaya of the noble ones?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la nyan thos rnams dang; rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni; 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la nyan thos rnams dang; rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni; 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, in this regard, the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are neither associated with desire

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they are neither associated with anger

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: gti mug dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they are neither associated with delusion

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they are neither associated with the view of the transitory collection

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: the tshom dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: the tshom dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they are neither associated with doubt

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they are neither associated with pride in discipline and ritual

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor dissociated from it;

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He is not associated with or dissociated from desire realm attachment,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod @235b chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod @235b chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: malice,🔽form realm attachment,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: formless realm attachment,

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: ignorance,🔽pride,

original: nga rgyal dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: excitement,

original: bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the first concentration,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin / bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the second concentration,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the third concentration,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽byams pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin / byams pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: the fourth concentration,🔽love,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: compassion,

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: joy,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /🔽btang snyoms dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the four immeasurables.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the four formless absorptions.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the five eyes.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the six superknowledges.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the three gateways to liberation.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the four unhindered abilities.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the perfection of giving.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.🔽It is not associated with or dissociated from the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the three gateways to liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa @236a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa @236a *//
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the four noble truths.

original: dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: dang; bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilities, the aspects of liberation, the serial steps of meditative stability, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang ldan ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang ldan ba'ang ma yin /
translated: the wishlessness gate of liberation, the aspects of the extrasensory powers, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways;

original: bral pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral pa'ang ma yin /
translated: it is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, great loving kindness, or great compassion.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from the conditioned element or the unconditioned element.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin pas; de'i phyir de dag ni 'phags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin pas; de'i phyir de dag ni 'phags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are not separated from it, and therefore they are called noble.

original: 'di ni de dag gi chos dang 'dul ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi chos dang 'dul ba yin pas /
translated: This is their Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad gzugs med pa /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad gzugs med pa /
translated: Because all those dharmas are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /🔽de dag ni gzugs med pa dang / gzugs med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste / de dag ni gzugs med pa dang / gzugs med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are all of one mark, which is no mark.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: They are not connected with the formless, nor are they separated from it.

original: bstan du med pa dang / bstan du med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bral ba'ang ma yin no //🔽thogs pa med pa dang / @236b thogs pa med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bstan du med pa dang / bstan du med par ldan pa'ang ma yin / bral ba'ang ma yin no // thogs pa med pa dang / @236b thogs pa med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not connected with what cannot be shown, nor are they separated from it.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin no //🔽mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin no // mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid med par ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not connected with the unimpeded, nor are they separated from it.

original: bral ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: They are not connected with the absence of marks, nor are they separated from it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs med pa /
translated: “Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection that is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa /🔽mtshan nyid gcig pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa / mtshan nyid gcig pa /
translated: is unobstructed,🔽has one mark—that is, no mark—

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and is not a mark.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should train in it.

original: des de la bslabs na /
analyzed: des de la bslabs na /
translated: Having trained in it,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not apprehend any mark of a dharma at all.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'o na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: should they not train in the mark of form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the mark of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the mark of the constituents, or in the mark of the sense fields, or in the mark of dependent origination?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the mark of the perfection of giving?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi 'am; nang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi 'am; nang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: “Should one not train in the defining characteristics of the perfection of generosity, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /🔽bsam gtan dang po'i mtshan @237a *//
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / bsam gtan dang po'i mtshan @237a *//
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of inner emptiness, up to the defining characteristics of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: “Should one not train in the defining characteristics of the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration?

original: byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi 'am; nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi 'am; nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skya mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skya mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the applications of mindfulness?

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam pa mthar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi @237b 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /🔽byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /🔽snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam pa mthar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi @237b 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: “Should one not train in the characteristics of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the meditative stabilizations of the aspects of the aspects of the path, the serial and nondiscursive meditative stabilizations, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways?🔽“Should one not train in the characteristics of the tathāgata powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?🔽“Should one not train in the characteristics of great love?🔽“Should one not train in the characteristics of great compassion?🔽“

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: “Should they not train in the characteristics of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the meditative stabilizations of the aspects of the aspects of the path, the meditative stabilizations of the aspects of the aspects of the path, the meditative stabilizations of the aspects of the aspects of the path, the meditative stabilizations of the aspects of
