original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @246a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @246a *//
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi bsgom mo //
analyzed: dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi bsgom mo //
translated: the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, up to the knowledge of all aspects, and the relinquishment of all afflictive emotions together with their remaining propensities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / dngos po'i 'du shes can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po'i 'du shes can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
translated: Subhūti, those who have the notion of an existent thing do not cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
translated: Those who have the notion of an existent thing do not cultivate the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, or the perfection of generosity.

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i bar du med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i bar du med do //
translated: For those who have the notion of things, there is no giving, no morality, no patience, no perseverance, no concentration, no wisdom, up to no relinquishment of all residual impressions, predispositions, and afflictive emotions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te /🔽sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i bar la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i bar la /
translated: Because they are attached to the two extremes, thinking, ‘This is my self.’

original: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur pas /
translated: They are attached to the two extremes, thinking, ‘This is my self,’ in regard to giving, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, wisdom, up to the relinquishment of all residual impressions, predispositions, and afflictive emotions.

original: gang mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur ba de la ni thar pa med de /
analyzed: gang mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur ba de la ni thar pa med de /
translated: Those who are attached to the two extremes do not have liberation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / dngos po'i 'du shes can la ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po'i 'du shes can la ni /
translated: Subhūti, for those who have the notion of things,

original: sbyin pa'ang med /
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang med /
translated: there is no giving,

original: tshul khrims kyang med /🔽bzod @246b pa'ang med /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang med / bzod @246b pa'ang med /
translated: no morality,🔽no patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyang med /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang med /
translated: no perseverance,

original: bsam gtan yang med /
analyzed: bsam gtan yang med /
translated: no concentration,

original: shes rab kyang med /
analyzed: shes rab kyang med /
translated: There is no wisdom.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i bar du'ang yongs su shes pa med na /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i bar du'ang yongs su shes pa med na /
translated: Up to the complete knowledge of the abandonment of all the afflictions that connect to latent tendencies does not exist,

original: de thar par 'gyur ba lta ga las yod /
analyzed: de thar par 'gyur ba lta ga las yod /
translated: how could there be liberation?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
analyzed: dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
translated: what is a thing?

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
translated: What is a non-thing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gnyis ni dngos po yod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis ni dngos po yod pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, duality is a thing.

original: mi gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Non-duality is a non-thing.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: gnyis zhes bgyi ba ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gnyis zhes bgyi ba ji lta bu lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is duality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: “Subhūti, the perception of form is duality.🔽The perception of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is duality.

original: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so /
analyzed: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so /
translated: The perception of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination is duality.

original: blang ba dang / dor ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of adopting and rejecting is twofold.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /🔽rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par @247a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par @247a *//
translated: The notion of the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothingness, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception is twofold.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: Recollection of the Buddha, recollection of the Dharma, recollection of the Saṅgha, recollection of morality, recollection of generosity, recollection of the gods, recollection of the breath,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: recollection of death, and the perception of the aspects of the body.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: The perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of selflessness, the perception of repulsiveness, the perception of non-entityness, the perception of self, the perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed can gyi 'du shes dang / shed bdag gi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed can gyi 'du shes dang / shed bdag gi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the notion of life, the notion of birth, the notion of nurture, the notion of person, the notion of individual, the notion of soul, the notion of being, the notion of one who does,

original: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of one who feels, the notion of one who knows, the notion of one who sees,

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of purity, the notion of self,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of the factors of awakening,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @247b par 'jug pa dgu'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @247b par 'jug pa dgu'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, the eight liberations, and the nine serial absorptions,

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //🔽sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of all the perfections and all the emptinesses is dualistic.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, worthy one, pratyekabuddha, and buddha is dualistic.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams @248a *//
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams @248a *//
translated: The notion of the compounded element and the notion of the uncompounded element

original: kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: are dualistic.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar de snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / de snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis te; ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar de snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / de snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis te; ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
translated: As much as there is duality, there is so much of a substantial world.

original: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o //
translated: As much as there is a substantial world, there is so much of cyclic existence.

original: ji tsam du 'khor bde tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'khor bde tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol lo //
translated: As much as there is cyclic existence, there is so much of the birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, anxiety, and tribulation of sentient beings.

original: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The non-attention to all perceptions is non-duality.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / tshul khrims med pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus med pa dang / bsam gtan med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / tshul khrims med pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus med pa dang / bsam gtan med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations it should be understood that for those who have the notion of duality there is no generosity, no morality, no patience, no effort, no concentration, no wisdom,

original: lam med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: no path, no attainment, and no clear realization.

original: rab 'byor / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni chung ngu na mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni chung ngu na mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang med na /
translated: Subhūti, for those who have the notion of duality there is not even the acquiescence of agreement,

original: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could there be the thorough understanding of form?🔽How could there be the thorough understanding of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the thorough understanding of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination?

original: blang ba dang / dor ba yongs su shes @248b par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba yongs su shes @248b par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand what to adopt and what to reject?

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' pa dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' pa dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of ethical discipline, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the gods, the recollection of disillusionment,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the recollection of inhalation and exhalation, the recollection of death, and the knowledge of the aspects of the body?

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: How could they understand the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of no-self, the perception of repulsiveness, the perception of non-entityness, the perception of self, the perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed can gyi 'du shes dang / shed bdag gi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed can gyi 'du shes dang / shed bdag gi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
translated: how could they understand the notion of life, the notion of birth, the notion of nurturing, the notion of a person, the notion of an individual, the notion of a human being, the notion of a human, the notion of an agent,

original: @249a *// tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: @249a *// tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the notion of a feeler, the notion of a knower, and the notion of a seer?

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of beauty, and the notion of a self?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the factors of awakening?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signlessness meditative stabilization, the wishlessness meditative stabilization, the eight deliverances, or the nine serial absorptions?

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the meditative stabilization that is both investigative and analytical, the meditative stabilization that is non-investigative but analytical, or the meditative stabilization that is neither investigative nor analytical?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the four noble truths—the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path? How could they understand the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the arising of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and the knowledge of the path?

original: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @249b yod; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @249b yod; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
translated: How could they understand the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of termination, the knowledge of nonarising, the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of subsequent engagement, the knowledge of conventions, the knowledge of familiarization, or the knowledge that accords with what is heard?🔽How could they understand the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the emptinesses,

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang /
translated: the six clairvoyances, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the buddhadharmas,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: or great love and great compassion?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: gang la lam bsgom pa med pa de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ga la yod /
analyzed: gang la lam bsgom pa med pa de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the result of stream enterer where there is no cultivation of the path?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang ga la yod /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa lta'ang ga la yod /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las; le'u lnga bcu brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa lta'ang ga la yod /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las; le'u lnga bcu brgyad pa'o ////
translated: How could there be the abandonment of all afflictions with their residual impressions?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar @250a *//
analyzed: gal te de ltar @250a *//
translated: if it is like that,

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can la /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can la /
translated: for those who have the notion of entities

original: mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang ma mchis pas /
analyzed: mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang ma mchis pas /
translated: there is no acquiescence in conformity,

original: thob pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis /
analyzed: thob pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis /
translated: let alone attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa lta'ang ga la mchis te ma mchis na ci lags /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa lta'ang ga la mchis te ma mchis na ci lags /
translated: let alone clear realization.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la /
translated: for those who have the notion of nonentities

original: mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
analyzed: mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
translated: there is no acquiescence in conformity,

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of seeing what is white,

original: rigs kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'am /
translated: no ground of the family,

original: brgyad pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of the eighth,

original: mthong ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of seeing,

original: bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of thinning out,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of being free from attachment,

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of realizing what has been done,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: no ground of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
translated: no ground of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: no ground of a buddha,

original: lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing /
translated: and no ground of cultivating the path.🔽What afflictions would obscure

original: nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
translated: what?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas /
translated: and without entering into the secure state of a bodhisattva,🔽they will not attain the knowledge of all aspects;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /
translated: and without attaining the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa /🔽nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa / nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: they will not eliminate all the afflictions along with their underlying patterns.🔽Is there a path for eliminating the afflictions of śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
translated: and pratyekabuddhas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba ma mchis na /
translated: if there is no arising of any phenomena that arise,

original: ji ltar chos de dag ma bskyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par @250b 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar chos de dag ma bskyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par @250b 'gyur /
translated: how will they attain the knowledge of all aspects without having generated those phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
translated: There is no acceptance of what is suitable for those who have the perception of the absence of things.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of clear realization.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of seeing the white [dharma].

original: rigs kyi sa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no level of the lineage.

original: brgyad pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no eighth level.

original: mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of seeing.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of thinning.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of separation from desire.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of realizing what has been done.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no pratyekabuddha level.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no bodhisattva level.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no buddha level.🔽What is the path of meditation?

original: lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
translated: What is the obscuration of the afflictions?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas /
translated: What is the bodhisattva level?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /
translated: What is the level of the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa /🔽nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa / nyan thos dang ldan pa'am / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam med do //
translated: the obscuration that consists in the non-abandonment of all the moral defilements that are the cause of the latent proclivities;🔽the obscuration that consists in the non-abandonment of the moral defilements that are associated with the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas;

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: and the obscuration that consists in the non-existence of the path for the abandonment of those moral defilements.

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis par 'du shes pa mchis sam /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis par 'du shes pa mchis sam /
translated: Subhuti : Can it be that the Bodhisattva, the great being, when he courses in the perfection of wisdom, has the notion of an existent or a non-existent dharma,

original: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @251a *//
analyzed: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @251a *//
translated: the notion of form, of feeling, of perception, of impulses, of consciousness,

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / skye mched dang / khams su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags spang bar 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / skye mched dang / khams su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags spang bar 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the notion of the sense fields, the elements, of attachment, of the abandonment of attachment, of hatred, of the abandonment of hatred, of delusion, of the abandonment of delusion, of the fruit of a Streamwinner, of a Once-Returner, of a Never-Returner, of Arhatship, of the fruit of a Pratyekabuddha, of a Buddha, of the perfection of giving, of morality, of patience, of vigour, of the perfection of meditation, of the perfection of wisdom, of the applications of mindfulness, of the right efforts, of the bases of psychic power, of the faculties, of the powers, of the limbs of enlightenment, of the path, of emptiness, of the signless, of the wishless, of the fruit of a Streamwinner, of a Once-Returner, of a Never-Returner, of Arhatship, of a Pratyekabuddha, of a Buddha, of the knowledge of all modes, of the cognition of the path, of the cognition of the all-knowing, of the cognition of the particular?

original: zhe sdang spang bar 'du shes pa dang / gti mug tu 'du shes pa dang / gti mug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / ma rig par 'du shes pa dang / ma rig pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang /🔽'du byed spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug tu 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang spang bar 'du shes pa dang / gti mug tu 'du shes pa dang / gti mug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / ma rig par 'du shes pa dang / ma rig pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug tu 'du shes pa dang /
translated: It is to perceive anger and to perceive the abandonment of anger. It is to perceive delusion and to perceive the abandonment of delusion. It is to perceive ignorance and to perceive the abandonment of ignorance. It is to perceive formations and to perceive the abandonment of formations.🔽It is to perceive consciousness and to perceive the abandonment of consciousness. It is to perceive name and form and to perceive the abandonment of name and form. It is to perceive the six sense sources and to perceive the abandonment of the six sense sources.

original: skye mched drug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / reg par 'du shes pa dang / reg pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sred par 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched drug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / reg par 'du shes pa dang / reg pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sred par 'du shes pa dang /
translated: It is to perceive contact and to perceive the abandonment of contact. It is to perceive sensation and to perceive the abandonment of sensation. It is to perceive craving and to perceive the abandonment of craving.

original: sred pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / len par 'du shes pa dang / len pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / srid par 'du shes pa dang / srid pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye bar 'du shes pa dang / skye ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang /🔽rga shir 'du shes pa dang / rga shi spang bar 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don par 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don @251b pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sred pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / len par 'du shes pa dang / len pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / srid par 'du shes pa dang / srid pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye bar 'du shes pa dang / skye ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rga shir 'du shes pa dang / rga shi spang bar 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don par 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don @251b pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of craving, the perception of abandoning craving, the perception of grasping, the perception of abandoning grasping, the perception of existence, the perception of abandoning existence, the perception of birth, the perception of abandoning birth,🔽the perception of old age and death, the perception of abandoning old age and death, the perception of sorrow and lamentation, the perception of abandoning sorrow and lamentation, the perception of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal kun shes par bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar spong bar 'du shes pa dang / 'gog par 'du shes pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya bar 'du shes pa dang / lam du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun shes par bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar spong bar 'du shes pa dang / 'gog par 'du shes pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya bar 'du shes pa dang / lam du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of understanding suffering, the perception of origination, the perception of abandoning origination, the perception of cessation, the perception of manifesting cessation, the perception of the path,

original: lam bsgom par 'du shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: lam bsgom par 'du shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'du shes pa'am /
translated: or the idea of cultivating the path, or the idea of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'du shes pa'i bar du mchis sam /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'du shes pa'i bar du mchis sam /
translated: or the idea of abandoning all the afflictions along with their traces and latencies?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni med do //
translated: “Subhūti, there is not.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽chos gang la'ang dngos po yod par 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / chos gang la'ang dngos po yod par 'du shes pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not have the idea that any phenomenon exists

original: dngos po med par 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'du shes pa med do //
translated: or the idea that any phenomenon does not exist.🔽Those who do not have the idea that any phenomenon exists

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni /
translated: or the idea that any phenomenon does not exist

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: have the acceptance that accords with reality, which is that of bodhisattva great beings.

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: The path is the cultivation of the path where there is no perception of things as existent or as nonexistent.

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is where there is no perception of things as existent or as nonexistent.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ path is not a thing,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: and the realization is not a thing.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs @252a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs @252a *//
translated: Subhūti, in this way

original: des kyang / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that all phenomena are the nonexistence of intrinsic nature.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the nonexistence of intrinsic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
translated: “The Tathāgata has fully awakened to all dharmas as having the nature of non-entities.

original: de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
analyzed: de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
translated: Having fully awakened to them, he has gained mastery over the domain of all dharmas.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti then asked him,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: “Lord, when I was practicing the bodhisattva conduct,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe; 'dod pas dben /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe; 'dod pas dben /
translated: when I was practicing the six perfections, I was isolated from desire,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
translated: isolated from evil nonvirtuous dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with thought and reflection,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: and with the joy and bliss born of isolation,

original: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: I accomplished and dwelt in the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas par gyur te /
translated: I attained the fourth meditative concentration and remained there.

original: 'on kyang ngas bsam gtan de dag dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngas bsam gtan de dag dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung ste /
translated: I did not grasp at the signs of those meditative concentrations or the branches of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan de dag gis snyems par ma gyur /🔽bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar ma gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag gis snyems par ma gyur / bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar ma gyur /
translated: I did not become conceited about those meditative concentrations.🔽I did not savor the taste of those meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan du dmigs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan du dmigs par ma gyur te /
translated: I did not focus on those meditative concentrations.

original: de ltar na ngas @252b bsam gtan de dag rnam pa yongs su dag pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: de ltar na ngas @252b bsam gtan de dag rnam pa yongs su dag pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: In this way, I entered into the meditative concentrations with a pure aspect.

original: de ltar ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam par smin par byas nas /🔽lha'i mig shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir; sems gzhol bar bya /
analyzed: de ltar ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam par smin par byas nas / lha'i mig shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir; sems gzhol bar bya /
translated: In this way, I ripened those meditative concentrations.🔽I directed my mind to the knowledge of the divine eye in order to actualize it.

original: lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /🔽sems gzhol bar bya /🔽pha rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir / sems gzhol bar bya / pha rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I directed my mind to the knowledge of the divine ear in order to actualize it.

original: sems gzhol bar bya /
analyzed: sems gzhol bar bya /
translated: I directed my mind to the knowledge of the thoughts of others in order to actualize it.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I directed my mind to the knowledge of the recollection of former lives in order to actualize it.

original: sems gzhol bar bya /
analyzed: sems gzhol bar bya /
translated: I focused my mind.

original: lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to actualize the knowledge of the divine eye,

original: sems gzhol bar bya /🔽'on kyang ngas mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba de dag la mtshan mar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems gzhol bar bya / 'on kyang ngas mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba de dag la mtshan mar bzung ste /
translated: I focused my mind.🔽However, I did not apprehend those superknowledges as signs,

original: mngon par shes pa de dag gis shes par ma gyur /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag gis shes par ma gyur /
translated: and I did not know them through those superknowledges,

original: ro myong bar ma gyur /
analyzed: ro myong bar ma gyur /
translated: I did not experience them,

original: dmigs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs par ma gyur te /
translated: and I did not objectify them.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag nam mkha' lta bur yang dag par rjes su dran pas mnyam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag nam mkha' lta bur yang dag par rjes su dran pas mnyam par bzhag ste /
translated: I was equipoised, recollecting those five superknowledges as being like space.🔽In that way, in a single instant, with the wisdom of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de ltar ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de ltar ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: I fully awakened to

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: this is suffering,
